Not worth the wait just because they're in a tourist area . Probably get a better steak at the keg next door better service for sure

I've been here a number of times for both the LUNCH TABLE D'HÔTE which is very reasonably priced and served up promptly and during the Happening Gourmand 2017 & 2018.  Perfect for a business lunch!  It comes with coffee/tea, entree, main and dessert (for $3 extra) all that for an average of $20! Go for it! 4/5  Talking about my most recent 2018 HG experience, I had tasted the filet mignon bacon-wrapped medallions and they were really good.  Tender and juicy!  This is the more pricey HG choice.  My friends and I opted for the herbs and green apple salmon tartare on the HG menu and we were all disappointed.  We had expected a crisp, fresh and slightly tart green apple flavor in the tartar but it ended up being quite tasteless and the bread crisps they served tasted stale.  The waiter seemed unenthusiastic about the food and serving in general.  AND he had poor waiting manners as he reached over other people at the table with his arm to serve instead of going beside the person being served, which was totally possible as we were sitting at a round table! He was also a bit grumpy.  Despite that, service was ok.  The restaurant was very quiet on a Thursday night maybe due to the weather.  My friend said the salmon was very steakhouse like, whatever that meant :) and was pretty decent.  I ordered the Beef Striploin NYCut and I was satisfied with the medium-well steak.  It wasn't the best steak I've ever had but definitely not the worst so middle road.   Dessert was Crème brûlée but was not served in ramekins as you'd expect but served in little dessert bowls--kinda weird.  Taste was ok.  So in conclusion, if I had to rate the lunchtime table d'hote, I wouldn't mind giving it a 4/5 but this time, the HG was just so-so for me which means 3/5 overall.

Since the Keg had an hour wait and I was with 2 grown men who were hungry, we came to Vieux-Port instead. Our waiter was too proud to be serving us, I really don't know how to say it, he never looked us while taking our order and was annoyed that we were even there! My salmon was well cooked, but extremely blend, my fiance's steak was apparently perfectly cooked.

The food was very good.  The service was a bit disappointing.  The server seemed rushed and inattentive.  I had red snapper which was the fish of the day and Joel had chicken and shrimp.  The restaurant was beautiful and had a wood burning fireplace.

On Sundays, they brunch! For $30 (canadian), there is a wide assortments of yummyness to choose from.   My brother and I decided to spend our new years day starting here. So much to choose from, hot breakfast items, omelettes made to order, prime rib, roast lamb, and so much more.   There is a lot of seating but Reservations are recommended, even the snow won't stop people from this delicious brunch spot.

We've dined at this old city restaurant many times and I sill consider their rack of lamb one of the best in Montreal. This weekend however we decided to try their Sunday Brunch and  was very satisfied at the wide range of options available,everything from the standard omelet  and roast beef carving stations,freshly baked breads and pastries,shrimp and smoked salmon,country pate to BBQ chicken,mussels,stuffed rigatoni,Dover sole and goat cheese raviolis.  All in all an excellent value for $24.99 Canadian per person. served only on Sundays from 10am to 3 pm. My one complaint however is my wife's mimosa and my bloody mary was devoid of any alcohol what so ever so at $7.00 a drink we had very dear orange and tomato juices.

We came here as part of a tour group.  The atmosphere and décor was gorgeous.  The service was very friendly and accommodating.  The food was outstanding!  I was very pleased with how they handled the large group and they were able to get all the food out and in a timely fashion.

This place was absolutely phenomenal !!! The brunch has to be one of the best I've ever experienced. Over 28 different items from bacon and eggs to prime rib and potatoes. The service was excellent and the food was even better . Also a must have item are the beef ribs . They actually cut the ribs of of the rib roast and serve them as well . If you're ever in Montreal you HAVE to check this place out , you can't go wrong !

Explored old town Montreal this afternoon and decided to stay around the area and search for dinner. We were in search for escargot and found this restaurant to have the most variety in menu options. Street parking only. The restaurant is quite large and has a second floor. Restrooms are clean and are situated upstairs. Staff is friendly and service was definitely fast.   For our appetizers, we ordered:  Green salad - mixed baby greens w shredded carrots and a lovely Dijon balsamic dressing. Light, refreshing and perfectly dressed.  Roast beef poutine - DELICIOUS! The roast beef was succulent, the gravy perfectly seasoned, the fries were crispy, & the melty cheese was just right...it was all prepared well and the flavors were spot on. We've never had poutine this good before. Bravo Canada!  French onion soup - my hubby's favorite soup of all time. The flavors were great and the broth was perfectly seasoned.   Escargot au gratin - I've never had escargot w cheese before. It tasted like a yummy pizza topping, garlicky and tender.   For our entrees, we ordered:  12 oz rib steak - this was part of their table d'hote menu where you choose an appetizer and entree for $23 and must order before 6pm. The steak was served w mashed potatoes and haricot vert + bell peppers. I must say this steak is in the top 3 of the best steaks I've ever had. Perfectly seasoned and the perfect amount of grill flavor. I ordered it medium and it came out a little bit more red than medium, but that's okay because I devoured that bad boy! Succulent melt in your mouth Canadian beefy goodness. Sides were good, too. YUM!  Lobster linguine - my hubby is a sucker for anything lobster + pasta. This dish was flavorful, but needed more lobster meat. This $25 pasta dish will only get you claw and knuckle meat. Hubby wasn't too happy about that.   Overall, the dinner was delicious, but nothing out of the ordinary. We would definitely return though bc the execution of the dishes were spot on and the flavors were great. The food came out fast and hot.

Help! Help!   This place seemed like a good choice to get a good Bloody Mary, but whoa nelly, was my group of friends and I wrong.   It seems, alcohol despite being advertised as a part of this classic cocktail, was only available upon request.  Definitely not a good place to have an overprice cocktail.  UPDATE: After being forced to order food, we settled on a dozen oysters. Half the oysters appeared to be missing, or so tiny they were non-existent.  tl;dr: AVOID THIS PLACE

Good flavorful steak with bacon butter. The salad was fresh and tasty Dijon dressing. The strawberry cheesecake was also good. They were busy on a Thursday evening so service was slow, but they tried! I would recommend if you want a good steakhouse steak, nice atmosphere too.

Went here last weekend and was delighted. The menu was nicely varied with some unusual choices. I had the ribeye with a side of half a grilled lobster. Loved the house Cabernet. Jimmy, our waiter, did a phenomenal job with a handful of complicating factors and was kind and polite through it all. Great place! We sat upstairs and the place was humming but not frantic. Great job!!

Perfect restaurant to bring visitors to the Old Port of Montreal for work dinner. The ambiance is great, stone walls, beautiful ceilings and operating fire place on each floor. If the municipality of Montreal could fix the side street our guests would be even more impressed, but of course that has nothing to do with the food quality.  The restaurant is advertising itself as a steak house and they are proud of their Canadian beef, as such they really know how to make a good steak. Very happy with my centre cut fillet mignon, prepared exactly medium rare as requested, very slightly burned from outside as I like it. Besides the steaks some of my companions also enjoyed their black cod. We wanted to share with our guests the pride of the Montreal cuisine, the roast beef poutine. The poutine was a little bit disappointing, fries were kind of cold and the roast beef presence was minimal. I guess we shocked the chef with that order.   The service is great. I started the night with classic dry martini, so good. The cocktail list needs to be explored by me again. With that said I would come some other time for a personal dinner and when in need of a good steak.
The steak and fries were amazing and so well done. The wait staff was incredible even when we had food allergies and I really enjoyed the environment:)

I happened to go here during the "Happening Gourmand"  The baseball cut sirloin was delicious. I could have used more garlic flavour in my mashed potatoes but I am a minority voice of garlic flavour lovers.  I was disappointed by the chocolate mousse cake duo. The cake was dry and ruined what was an excellent main course experience.  Pro Tip - The cocktail of the month "Le Janvier" is amazing - Vodka, Lillet and lemon juice (possible sugar too) melds a fresh citrusy punch

After a day of marketing meetings and cocktail hour, some of us went out for supper at the Vieux-Port Steakhouse in Old Montreal last night.  It's a cute spot in an old building.   There were 14 of us and we had no reservation ... we just showed up on someone's recommendation.  They were able to seat us over three tables.   I ordered the Rib Steak and garlic mashed potatoes.  It was tender and tasty ... I had ordered it medium-well and it was more medium-rare, though.   It is a nice restaurant ... a place to go for a special occasion. Tom took good care of us.
31 dec 2015 repas parfait .Bons classiques;escargots saumon fumé et le plus que parfait filet mignom j'en avais vraiment  le goût.  Le super service de Jimmy je crois etait top niveau. Cheers to 2016

Visited Vieux-Port Steakhouse for Easter Brunch. The food was meh. We waited an extra 20 minutes even with reservations. The front of house was very disorganized. The hostess wasn't friendly and waiting area was packed. We were led to our table but had to stand there while they changed the tablecloths and plates and silverware.  Maybe service and food (buffet) suffered because of the holiday crowd but I won't return.
Can't go wrong with this place. Steaks are always great, not overpriced and a great selection of wines. The service is always fantastic as well.

Not the best steakhouse I have ever been to, but was a great stop when looking for a steak.  I visited on my last trip to Montreal for Formula 1 and it did not disappoint. The meats were great and the seafood dishes were very fresh.  Everyone (group of 17) I was with enjoyed their respective dishes and the outdoor setting area.  We made a reservation and were able to sit all together at 1 table.  I ordered the Rib Steak and garlic mashed potatoes.  It was very tender and tasty ... I had ordered it medium-rare, as all steaks should be.  I split the crab cake and Seafood platter with two other people and enjoyed all of the dishes.

We choose this restaurant after our first choice next store had too long a wait.  We ended up being happy for the "2nd" choice.  The restaurant is beautiful -- lots of levels but cozy feel.  Waiter was very attentive.  My kids ordered steak and the striped bass.  I ordered the baseball cut steak as well but with the peppercorn sauce.  The peppercorn sauce was incredible -- among finest I have had.  Only thing that was disappointing was escargot -- too much cheese.  The kids loved their meals as well.  Although quite fancy, my causal kids felt at ease on second level and we had to-die-for view of street.

My aunt and I were tourists exploring Old Town who happened to get hungry and look for places to eat. Luckily, VPS had a menu out front that had a more affordable lunch menu, so we already knew what we wanted when we walked in.   The place was fairly empty expect for a couple parties and although quite dark inside, extremely elegant, with an Old World, mahogany wood style as we were immediately seated.   Our waiter, who is bilingual, was very helpful and attentive. We ordered the hamburger steak for her and the Chicken Brochette for myself. Although we both ordered salads for starters, she got the cauliflower soup instead and decided to eat it (she's very polite)! To her surprise, she enjoyed it greatly!   The house dinner rolls were warm and plump and lovely. My heart wanted more but my head told me no! Haha!   As my aunt told me stories about traveling the Mediterranean, she thoroughly enjoyed her hamburger steak and veggie sides as I enjoyed my chicken brochette which came with rice pilaf that was soft and delicious and cooked spinach. The citrus salad on the brochette gave it a sweet edge that I haven't had in California and enjoyed it immensely.   We also have to point out that at 12 noon, the bathrooms were impeccably clean and had a lovely scent. I felt completely at home there.   We'll return should we be back. Merci!

My husband and I took the kids to this old school Montreal steakhouse for New Years Eve. We loved the neighborhood and the atmosphere, and were seated at a great table by a window on the second floor. My husband enjoyed the French onion soup appetizer then we both got steak, I liked my filet and I also ordered a blue cheese sauce. All in all it was a decent meal but I wasn't blown away by the food. Good overall experience and service.

Lovely little steakhouse in Vieux Port! We got a table by the  (real wood burning) fire and were treated to outstanding service.  The food was great, though perhaps not 5 stars-blow-your-mind oustanding. I had the salmon, husband had the baseball steak. We also had the salmon tartare appetizer which was great! This place is a solid choice for a lovely dining experience that is very affordable. If you go for "early dinner" before 6pm (which for us was actually late lunch at 4:45), you get an appetizer and main course for $23. Seriously. With the conversion rate, that's only around $16 US for a steak, potatoes, and salad. So go and enjoy!

Went there during the MTLatable event.They offer a special menu during that time.  We had appetizers, iron flat steak, lamb ribs and two desserts. The steak was OK according to my husband. My lamb ribs was good with perfect cooking time. The flavor of meat is not so distinct. No wow- factor.  The salmon tartar for appetizer was very bland. There was a genuine fire place. The deco was very nice. The building was a warehouse a hundred year ago. Overall a very average steakhouse.

I don't understand how this restaurant gets five stars for their steak.  It was tough to chew.  They also charged $18 for mac and cheese and $15 for tomatoes and mozzarella cheese.  It must be a tourist trap as I wouldn't go back and pay that price again.
The food was delicious. My husband and I were looking for a good and meal and this place left us satisfied. I would definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a good steak.

Not sure why, but on the iPad Yelp app this restaurant has a *much* lower rating.  Basically, they all say the same thing : awful service.  The steak we had was fine.  But we waited over 30 minutes for each course, and eventually skipped the dessert which was included in our set, because we didn't want to spend the whole night there.  A table of four people was seated beside us, only to leave after 30 minutes of no service whatsoever.  Even when we tried to get out, we had to ask twice for the bill.  At one point in the evening, we did not see our waiter for an hour.  A shame, because the restaurant itself is quite nice, and the food was ok.

La première fois que je suis allée à ce restaurant c'était pour un brunch pour la fête des mères. J'ai vraiment apprécié l'endroit. Ils nous ont proposé un imposant buffet avec une multitude de choix de viennoiseries, des fruits, des salades, des choix de viandes, des plats préparés (ex: cannelloni, purée de pomme de terre, riz, oeufs). Tout était savoureux, le service courtois et efficace. Puis je suis revenue au cours de l'été et nous avons pu profiter de la terrasse à l'arrière. Au calme, dans une ruelle pas trop passante, j'ai pris les pâtes au homard. J'ai vraiment été satisfaite de mon plat, il y avait de nombreux morceaux de homard, la sauce était crémeuse et bien assaisonnée. Ma mère a pris du saumon et mon père la bavette. Tous les deux ont été ravis de leur plat. Je suis revenu cette année pour le brunch de la nouvelle année. Quelque peu déçue par la section viennoiseries, les choix étaient nettement plus limités, beaucoup trop de desserts à mon avis, ce qui est trop sucré et riche pour le matin. Pas autant de croissant/chocolatine/brioches/baguette de pain.... :( Aussi service nettement moins efficace, nous devions constamment faire un signe afin de se faire servir du café. Aucun esprit de vente de la part des serveurs, un mimosa avec ça ?!? Moi en tout cas j'en voulait un et j'ai donc du trouver un serveur pour le commander :D

Don't even bother. This place looks nice from outside and it's actually welcoming too. The staff are very nice, cozy atmosphere and table appointments are clean and neat. The service is what's getting a star. Our server Alan was very nice. So, I ordered a Manhattan (drink). And It was was terrible. I believe that it should be quite obvious that (at least for a restaurant in the middle of old Montréal, which is a prominent tourist attraction), cocktails made with clear liquids should be stirred and not shaken. However, when I mentioned that my drink was shaken to the manager, he proudly announced that they always shake their Manhattan. It's actually a shame. They should know better. Now the steak. When you come into a steakhouse and order a ribeye, you naturally juice up your mouth believing that soon you will be enjoying the juicy medium rare steak seasoned to perfection and to your taste. That's not the case. Believe me. I guarantee you that you will have to chew your steak at least 2 minutes before you can actually swallow it . It's rough. It's dry(medium rare) and it's actually tasteless. I have never had a steak that bad. I actually wonder where they get their steaks. I took a picture of it believing that it will be tasty, because it looks delicious. Anyways, I think I've too much time describing all this. Save your money and time. Go somewhere worthy and this place isn't.

We had supper on the terrace on a Tuesday evening.  The terrace is lovely and the weather was beautiful!  Our waiter was helpful and attentive.  We had the seafood platter for two, which is supposed to be an appetizer, for our meal.  Once you have salad first and add a couple of vegetables, it does make a good meal.  The food was excellent.  Some lovely chardonnay complemented the meal.    We shared Creme brulee for dessert, with some cappuccino.  Our only complaint was that the "decaf" cappuccino might not have actually been decaffeinated.    It was a wonderful evening and we'll be back again on our next trip to Montreal!
A very nice and cozy environment. My boyfriend and I attended the New Years Eve celebration the Steakhouse hosted and it exceeded our expectations. The staff are all friendly and the food is amazing.

I'm trying hard to think when I've had a worse meal and I'm just not coming up with anything. Went there Friday night as we go once or twice a summer and enjoy dining on their terrasse. I was in the mood for steak frites however they only offer that on their lunch menu. I asked the waiter if they would substitute the mashed potatos and veggies for french fries on my $38.00? He immediately said no! Odd so I order a $19.00 VP Hamburger which came with french fries. So obviously they were still making fries for their dinner menu. NOW why in the world would you not take an order for a $38 steak and instead turn it into an order for a $19 hamburger.??? Doesn't make sense, am I right.....LOL ! Their loss I thought. My partner ordered the steak. We waited some time for our appetizer which never came. We flagged down our waiter who said he didn't hear us order the calamari. Said he would bring it with our meal if that was o.k. Well skip the calamari as it's huge thick  chewy rubber bands cooked in batter. Hardly digestible. The meat in our dinner was the same. My partners steak was over cooked, not reasonable for a diner let along some place that touts themselves as a "steakhouse". The hamburger was worse, overcooked and dry as a bone. Could have gone to 5 Guys and had a juicy hamburger for $5.00. The bun the hamburger was on was old and dried up the top of the bun was falling apart it was so dry.We won't be going back!

One of the best steaks I've ever had! They also have an "early dinner" option if you order before 6 that is very reasonably priced! I had the Quebec rib-eye and it was amazing! Excellent quality and their fois gois just melted in my mouth!  The service is very good as well! Our server made recommendations and we enjoyed the atmosphere!

I was here last Friday during their 7th annual Happening Gourmand promotion, where a few restaurants in the Old Port take part in reduced price table d'hote menus. I have dined at Vieux Port Steakhouse on another occasion and can say the quality and portion is usually better when you're paying full price. When we arrived close to 6, the restaurant looked empty but were told everything had been reserved and we would either have to sit at the bar, or finish our meal within an hour and a half. We opted for the latter and were seated at a tiny table, below the staircase, but near the fireplace.  I remember the previous time I was here, my friend and I, early 20's were dressed casually, despite it not being a busy day or time, we were seated on the second floor. It seemed that the main (and nicest) dining area downstairs was kept for the best dressed diners, or fancier looking, mature crowd. I rarely feel this way elsewhere, but I really believe they wanted us hidden. So I strongly recommend a reservation if you want any chance at a good table.  Naturally, serviced was speedy since they wanted us out fast. I ordered a mesclun salad with a dijon honey vinaigrette, filet mignon medallion and blueberry cake on a fixed 25$ menu. My starter was delicious, so simple and sweet that it made me salivate for more to come. Beef was cooked the way I wanted it, accompanied with shrimps and supposed roasted garlic mashed potatoes but I couldn't taste it. The green beans and shrimps were dry, I actually had to smear butter onto them that was intended for my bread.  Right before ordering, the waiter did warn us that it was going to be just one medallion, which implied that there might not be much on the plate and he was right, the portion is much smaller than what I would normally expect. As for dessert, my cake was nothing memorable, I've had tastier supermarket treats.  The special menu is a teaser, a sampler for what this establishment can offer. It may seem like a good opportunity to try this restaurant if you like deals, but for a few dollars extra, you'll be a lot more satisfied. Forgo the salad and generic gateau, get 2 of their filets mignons medallions on a fuller size plate for 29$.

Wanted steak and also wanted to go someplace different.  Came across Vieux-Port during our stroll in Old Montreal.  Menu looked attractive and the patio, or "garden" seating sold us.  The place was pretty crowded but the hostess was able to accommodate the four of us.  The waiters appeared busy and did not spend too much time on any one table.  My wife and I ordered wine - the Bordeaux.  The waiter spilled her's and there was wine at the bottom of the stem - sloppy.  My wine was a very non-generous pour.  I blamed the speed of the waiter as opposed to the restaurant trying to be thrifty. I did order a second glass and the pour was better.  The steaks were delicious.  The ribeye was done to perfection; the sirloin the kids ordered was a bit tough.  The bread is to die for!  The only problem with the outdoor seating was the bugs.  There isn't much air movement in the back patio, which encourages the bugs to hang out.  Overall, good food, good atmosphere!

i came here for sunday brunch. It wasn't as busy as we expected it to be but i think the marathon that had the street closed off played a big part in that. the options were impressive. notable buffet selections were smoked salmon, shrimp cocktail, roast beef, beef ribs, canoli, omelette. the fruits were fresh and tasted very good. the desserts, however, were much to sweet for my liking.  an added bonus, in the men's room there were dispensers for mints, chewing gum, and ribbed condoms. very intriguing.

We were a table of 6 and the waiter was extremely patient and friendly with us. Interesting menu with great flavour combinations. Our steak was cooked to perfection and we were happy with the fresh seafood as well. Their goat cheese salad is to die for!!  The only down part is the wait time for our food to arrive at our table. As for the appetizers, the soups also were a bit bland and boring.  Hence, overall, it was a good experience in the middle of Old Port Montreal, and would definitely recommend if you want a good steak!

Excellent!! My fiancee and I went here. The staff was very welcoming, very attentive and friendly. The food outstanding! I have never had Buffalo and I must say I have been missing out. It was cooked perfect along with my filet mignon. We had French Onion soup and escargot that was so delicious. We finished off with creme brulee flambe that alo g with the view it was delish. Allow around fantastic place to eat. The best meal I had in Montreal,if I came back it would definitely be to eat here.
L'excellentissime! Serveurs au top, plats variés, bien cuits. Nous avons pris les linguini au homard. Un vrai régal.

I have been to this place about 3 times and my latest experience was the best one. Our friendly waiter George was wonderful and the food was really good! We went for the MTL a Table event which makes it even better because the three course meal was only $21! Would recommend this restaurant to anyone. Gives a chance for change rather than always going to the same steakhouse (aka the keg)

Great restaurant! very friendly staff and the food was great! I had the Lunch Special for $23 i got a soup, and a 12oz Rib eye Steak with mashed potatoes and steamed veggies which was very tasty! They also give fresh bread buns with butter as soon as you sit down.  Will go back for sure when we are visiting Montreal again!
Great restaurant and service. Lobster bisque was ok and onion soup not the best. But the steaks were delicious and the wine is reasonably priced. I have been two times already and would go again.

ATMOSPHERE: The restaurant itself was lovely. Bigger than I expected on the inside and it's location offers a nice view of the streets of the Old Port. It has a rustic vibe to it.  FOOD: The appetizers and desserts were good but I was very disappointed with my main course. The steaks here were not flavorful, especially once you got towards the middle of the steak. I am usually one who always finishes my plate but I wasn't able to finish this meal. I will not be coming back here again unfortunately.  PRICE: I came here as a business event so I wasn't too familiar with the prices.  SERVICE: Service was good. They were efficient (especially since we were a very large group) and the bartenders were nice as well.

Sat at the bar in the back. Wifi spotty - not available when we were there. Escargot was amazing...so amazing that we got two orders for the both of us. Bartender/waiter who helped us was the best we encountered on our trip. Made the BEST Bloody Ceasars. Seafood (calamari and crab cakes were ok). Stick with the beef and escargot.

If Vieux-Port Steakhouse was a man, I'd hug him, kiss him on both cheeks and smack him on the butt. This place was down right GOOD. Let me set the stage, since I am a writer, and this place just fell into my life like a perfect storybook romance.   It was a chilly evening. The sister and her boyfriend and I had spent the day downtown, shopping and milling about. Our hands were filled with shopping bags with tissue exploding over the tops, hugging our purchases tight.   We took the metro to Place D'Armes, and as soon as we popped to the surface, I gasped. I LOVE Old Montreal. Truly, outside of Paris, there is nothing better in this world than Old Montreal. Nearly skipping, we walked down the street to the port, and sighed as the boats floated in the water, breathed the cool air in as joggers breezed past us ... but in the distance, the skies were black as night, thunder screaming at us, bolts of lightning shooting over the historical area.  Rain began to pour as we turned down Rue St Paul. Boutiques, souvenir shops and restaurants lined the street, each one begging for us to enter. We did, picking up even more shopping bags as we walked. Finally, the rain poured down on the 400 year old cobblestone road and I looked across the street and saw the Vieux Port Steakhouse. So beautiful, so elegant, I knew we had to go in.   We were seated right away and just fell in love with the old world ambiance of this multi-level steakhouse. The food was divine (NY strip), the conversation absolutely wonderful and tea and dessert was lovely. We stayed for hours, talking and laughing and watching the downfall of rain, while our waiter checked on us every once in a while, but mostly leaving us alone in the way you want to be visited with every so often but left to your dinner guests.   I am counting the days until I can go back to this little slice of steakhouse heaven in the most beautiful place I've ever been.   I love you, Vieux Port Steakhouse.

Hostess didn't smile when we walk in. Very unwelcome. Waiters were rushed, broke two glasses during our short visit. Extremely salty food.  Unfriendly staff. Very unprofessional! Too bad I can't choose zero star. Please, for your own sake, go elsewhere.

It was an amazing experience. The food was delicious! They use fresh calamari. The rib eye steak and the NY strip loin was perfectly cooked. I think what blew us away was the service and the wonderful well lit back patio. :)

Je suis une fan du brunch du dimanche! pour 25 dollars c'est un peu le buffet club med :) Plusieurs sections à thème et plusieurs cuisiniers qui vous cuisent les oeufs comme vous voulez, les pâtes etc etc Le rapport qualité/prix est excellent, dans un cadre élégant. Depuis que j'ai découvert cette place, c'est là que je brunch avec mes amis le dimanche matin .... C'est smart et bon....juste avant d'aller faire sa promenade du dimanche dans le vieux montréal ....
Celebrating our anniversary and dining at Restaurant du Vieux Port. Our table wasn't quite ready so the maitre d'hôte offered us a glass of bubbly while we waited in the bar. Impeccable service!!

I went there last weekend as part of the Happening Gourmand event. The place was packed for a 3 course meal, 23$ deal. We were a large party but our waiter was outstanding and patient. Food was good and quite frankly, the restaurant was better than expected as I thought at first that this was a tourist trap. Not a bad place!
Très bon resto à ne pas manquer si vous avez le gout dun bon filet mignon. le service est excellent

Bouffe correcte, ambiance d'antan, vrai feu de foyer, 2etage plein de tables, lumieres tamisées. Service hyper rapide .. l'entrée est arrivée avant le cocktail ... la politique des protocoles du resto est skipé .. just let you know.

Let me begin by saying the food was pretty good and the steak was juicy and flavorful. I ordered the snails as an appetizer and the Manhattan Steak. First time I tried snail but they weren't too bad and the steak I really enjoyed w/ the sauce.  Now this place gets 3 stars because the server took forever to come and welcome us and take our orders. We were a group of 7 not that huge of a group and dinner was for 3.5 hrs. I do not think he really enjoyed our table and didn't really converse with us at all.  But as I said the food was good, just the service needs to be a bit better...

Had a wonderful night here.  Ate on the back, outdoor, patio which was quite lovely.  Wine list was quite nice and the bottle we got (Carnivor, a tuscan Cab Sauv) was terrific.  Bread was quite good and warm...as it should be.  I had the french onion soup, which was good - but not great.  It needed a bit more broth.  My boyfriend got the lobster bisque and thought it was very good.  We each got steaks (of course) - I got the Filet Mignon, which was cooked perfectly (medium-rare) and the mashed potatoes and haricot vert that accompanied the meats were quite good, he got the bone-in Rib-Eye, which was quite good and, again, cooked perfectly.  He had a baked potato and said it was good, but very dense.  We split a side of mac & cheese, which was very good.  We finished dinner off with a piece of the Chocolate Mousse Cake which was amazing.  We also had a very nice server!

We really enjoyed our dinner at this restaurant!! My husband is a meat lover and he really liked his dinner!! The personal is just wonderful!! I can't remember the name of the main host, but we received such an amazing treatment from him. He made everything perfect for our dinner and well our little daughter Clara loved him!  Thanks for everything!! We highly recommend the restaurant and the people who works over there.

Went for dinner with the Fiancé. He had the bison ribsteak, I had the ribeye. Both were pretty good. We shared calamari, foie gras and escargot. The foie gras could use a few more toasts. The calamari was ok, need better dipping sauce. The escargot au gratin was yummy, but it's hard to not enjoy anything with melted cheese. Service was good.

A disappointing steak experience and we will absolutely come back! Confused? Here's the story...we booked online and were seated outside promptly at our request. We ordered a bottle of wine, crab appetizer, I had the Porterhouse and my wife had the Filet medallions. Our server was Rodrigo (sp?) and was very pleasant. We never touched the wine bottle as he was continuously topping us up. Now for the meal... The crab was dry and overdone so we didn't finish it. The steaks came, we both ordered our steaks medium. My wife's was perfect but mine was bordering on well done. I mentioned it to the server and he wisked it away for a replacement. The new one came...very rare...not wanting to complain again as I'd already done so twice, I just sucked it up and ate about half. The manager came by, looked at my plate and asked how I had ordered it. I told him medium but I didn't want to complain. He said "my friend, that steak is blue, for $54 you should get exactly what you wanted". The bill came...only thing on there was the wine! I know kitchens can get busy and mistakes do happen, and because of the tremendous service we received, we will absolutely be back when we are in Montreal again!
